basis: User expresses strong, concrete commitment to a multi-step plan (reminders, urge-surfing, logging, substitutes) and explicitly plans a one-week test with reporting. Positive tone and specific contingencies indicate high likelihood of execution.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. Plan aligns with stated goals and past behavior; minor tension about occasional slips is acknowledged and mitigated with structured steps.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible perfectionism or all-or-nothing tendencies (need to follow plan exactly) but mitigated by flexibility (optional post-log reflection, non-food substitutes, willingness to skip steps if not helpful).
emotional_triggers: Evenings and boredom are primary BED triggers; heat and stress also noted as contextual factors.
coaching_notes: Maintain concise, stepwise guidance; reinforce evening cue strategies and hydration; encourage a simple, consistent logging routine and a weekly check-in to adapt timings or cues as needed.
